_comment: Created by ianb on 01/08/2014 12:54:10 using v2.1
title: How does the proportion of joiners and leavers vary across regions (Feb-March 2014)?
analysis_commentary: Here we look at variation across regional education and training boards at one point in time - between February and March 2014. The proportion of joiners is highest in Health Education Thames Valley (1.4%) and Health Education North Central and East London (1.3%). Proportion of leavers is also highest in Health Education Thames Valley (1%) and Health Education South London (1%). The largest difference between the proportion leaving and joining can be observed in the following Health Education boards: Thames Valley, North Central & East London, Wessex and North East.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, National Workforce Statistics
